input: Premise: In the early Olympic games, athletes used to run a mile and then recite a poem. Until the New York Mets baseball team suffered in 2007 arguably the worst collapse in Major League Baseball history. To describe the anguish fans felt, The New York Times turned to a poet, Frank Messina.
